subject: Spawn radvd on standby DVR-HA routers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-15 17:07:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d508c9c307f16fee26681f79bde2349936a68342', 'message': "Spawn radvd on standby DVR-HA routers

Currently, radvd is spawned only on the Primary DVR-HA Router
and local DVR routers on Computes with L3 Agent set to dvr mode.
Radvd is not spawned on Computes with L3 Agent set to dvr_snat
mode. RAs from the Primary Router don't reach VMs located on these
dvr_snat Computes and they have no radvd of their own, which means
these VMs cannot set their IPv6.

This is solved by spawning radvd on all DVR-HA Routers - both
Primary and Backup.

Closes-Bug: #1934666
Change-Id: Ib6cd04dd4b6265a4d348d992ea2e18f61da54ae6
"}]
commit_message:
Spawn radvd on standby DVR-HA routers

Currently, radvd is spawned only on the Primary DVR-HA Router
and local DVR routers on Computes with L3 Agent set to dvr mode.
Radvd is not spawned on Computes with L3 Agent set to dvr_snat
mode. RAs from the Primary Router don't reach VMs located on these
dvr_snat Computes and they have no radvd of their own, which means
these VMs cannot set their IPv6.

This is solved by spawning radvd on all DVR-HA Routers - both
Primary and Backup.

Closes-Bug: #1934666
Change-Id: Ib6cd04dd4b6265a4d348d992ea2e18f61da54ae6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/72/800972/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE: Radvd has to be spawned on standby DVR-HA routers too # due to the following bug: # https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1934666 if state == 'primary' or ri.router.get('distributed', False):

commit_message:
Correct reno for archiving task_log database records

The release note incorrectly stated that the Telemetry service calls
the /os-instance_usage_audit_log REST API to retrieve instance usage
data. Telemetry rather consumes the notifications that are only generated
when [DEFAULT]instance_usage_audit=True.

Related-Bug: #1877189

Change-Id: Iea358090c42877bedfdcc4a04019f6dc406176c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/44/801144/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: deployment, as the option causes Nova to generate audit notifications that Telemetry consumes from the message bus. Usage data can also be later retrieved by calling the ``/os-instance_usage_audit_log`` REST API [1].
deleted_lines: deployment, as the option causes Nova to generate audit data that Telemetry then retrieves from the server usage audit log API [1].

db: Remove "support" for configurable migration backends

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
DB layer suppress Forbidden to NotFound error

DB layer for metadef covers up a Forbidden error with NotFound in case
trying to perform any operation on namespace which user does not own.

This patch has removed this cover up so that end user will get
appropriate error message.

Change-Id: I9f05961c0b56efbede321271259848cfc96a98ee

commit_message:
[fix] cleanup metadata before index creation

This ps adds the code to clean up metatdata in same script as index creation.
Also deletes the explicit job for flushing as that was periodically
causing race condition during pod creation.

Change-Id: I50d8d05e07a52231be607fb6479cb94c94566542

commit_message:
Remove block storage v2 func tests

Cinder deleted the block storage API v2 support[1]. This makes the
openstacksdk-functional-devstack failing with

  openstack.exceptions.NotSupported: The block-storage service for
  devstack:RegionOne exists but does not have any supported versions.

So this patch removes the v2 functional tests from master as they cannot
be run any more. Later patches might needs to remove the whole v2
support.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/792299

Change-Id: I277c2a9269dff7602b3f36e3bb7b5fe2a5be1819

commit_message:
docs: Clarify host-model, host-passthrough differences

Based on review feedback from kashyap.

Change-Id: Ief5debad29c10a0903f70d68d5bee21b4c1424b0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/10/782410/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: in ``/usr/share/libvirt/cpu_map/*.xml`` that most closely matches the host and requests additional CPU flags to complete the match. This CPU model has a number of advantages: * It provides almost all of the host CPU features to the guest, thus providing close to the maximum functionality and performance possible. * It auto-adds critical guest CPU flags for mitigation from certain security flaws, *provided* the CPU microcode, kernel, QEMU, and libvirt are all updated. * It computes live migration compatibility, with the caveat that live migration in both directions is not always possible. In general, using ``host-model`` is a safe choice if your compute node CPUs are largely identical. However, if your compute nodes span multiple processor generations, you may be better advised to select a ``custom`` CPU model... note:: As noted above, live migration is not always possible in both directions when using ``host-model``. During live migration, the source CPU model definition is transferred to the destination host as-is. This results in the migrated guest on the destination seeing exactly the same CPU model as on source even if the destination compute host is capable of providing more CPU features. However, shutting down and restarting the guest on the may present different hardware to the guest, as per the new capabilities of the destination compute. In ``host-passthrough`` mode, the guest can only be live-migrated to a target host that matches the source host extremely closely. This includes the physical CPU model and running microcode, and may even include the running kernel. Use this mode only if your compute nodes have a very large degree of homogeneity (i.e. substantially all of your compute nodes use the exact same CPU generation and model), and you make sure to only live-migrate between hosts with exactly matching kernel versions. Failure to do so will result in an inability to support any form of live migration. .. note:: The reason for that it is necessary for the CPU microcode versions to match is that hardware performance counters are exposed to an instance and it is likely that they may vary between different CPU models. There may also be other reasons due to security fixes for some hardware security flaws being included in CPU microcode.
deleted_lines: in ``/usr/share/libvirt/cpu_map/*.xml`` that most closely matches the host, and requests additional CPU flags to complete the match. This configuration provides the maximum functionality and performance and maintains good reliability. With regard to enabling and facilitating live migration between compute nodes, you should assess whether ``host-model`` is suitable for your compute architecture. In general, using ``host-model`` is a safe choice if your compute node CPUs are largely identical. However, if your compute nodes span multiple processor generations, you may be better advised to select a ``custom`` CPU model.In ``host-passthrough`` mode, the guest can only be live-migrated to a target host that matches the source host extremely closely. This definitely includes the physical CPU model and running microcode, and may even include the running kernel. Use this mode only if: * Your compute nodes have a very large degree of homogeneity (i.e. substantially all of your compute nodes use the exact same CPU generation and model), and you make sure to only live-migrate between hosts with exactly matching kernel versions, *or* * You decide, for some reason and against established best practices, that your compute infrastructure should not support any live migration at all.

commit_message:
Add ovn-monitor-all option to ovn-controller

With monitor-all option, all ovn-controllers
do not enable conditional monitoring there
by reducing the load on the Southbound ovsdb-server.

Partial-Bug: #1936781
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia78c0873e7ac6488b3048ae8475cc87ec40022bb

commit_message:
Remove async from the container build command

This change removes the async instruction and polling from the container
build command. This is being done to ensure that the command is blocking
and to ensure we're respecting return codes when / if the build process
fails. At present the async instructions mask shell failures and this is
creating hard to debug issues further in the deployment process.

Closes-Bug: 1894067
Change-Id: I84592c98214490ae236ef77f0d733fc94902a9a0
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable Ansible fact cache

Without a fact cache for Ansible, using --start-at-task
doesn't work since it doesn't have the required Ansible
facts for the deployment to proceed. This change enables
the Ansible Fact Cache plugin and caches facts in the
workdir for the Playbook execution.

Closes-Bug: #1937140
Change-Id: Id4ef377c93e6439407ea4aba7f124dc73d0b8410
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/98/801698/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Caching facts allows us to use --start-at-task at any point without # the need to re-gather facts. env['ANSIBLE_CACHE_PLUGIN'] = "jsonfile" env['ANSIBLE_CACHE_PLUGIN_TIMEOUT'] = 7200 env['ANSIBLE_CACHE_PLUGIN_CONNECTION'] = os.path.join( workdir, "facts_cache")

commit_message:
Update db backup/restore retry for sending to remote

There is an additional error status 'Service Unavailable' which can
indicate the service is temporary unavailable. Adding that error
status to the retry list in case the issue is resolved during the
backup timeframe.

Change-Id: I9e2fc1a9b33dea3858de06b10d512da98a635015

Adding a reference query

commit_message:
Add ability to exclude variables from kolla-ansibles globals.yml

Sometimes it useful to override the kayobe global defaults to per-host or
per-group settings.

Change-Id: I3865993e773dca73533f06002efcee14e623c67b
Story: 2007834
Task: 40121

the pip resolver mechanism. [1]

commit_message:
Revert "Combine new modules into a single package"

This reverts commit 0ecc6e0bbbb0ca788e6924fcfb4925d6d30a108a.

Reason for revert: Broken requirements for rpm packaging. Unit tests
require ansible but is not capture in the rpm specs. Also, that is a 
problem just like adding cliff to the requirements as ansible
is not available by default.

Change-Id: I42ae05e4a674dfae544cfd8113ced5c41207740b

subject: Don't generate 10-neutron_wsgi.conf with internal tls
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-21 03:26:02.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/neutron/server.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/fb9ba4b89cc1ec44c61bb9afbc5a80f25429c039', 'message': "Don't generate 10-neutron_wsgi.conf with internal tls

When internal TLS is enabled we use a proxy in front of
neutron server. Config generated in change
I302558e718ce35c4d632137c5efa08f502939b40 conflicts with
the one generated for tls_proxy. Till we convert neutron_api
to be deployed with httpd, let's generate the wsgi config
only when enable_internal_tls is false.

Closes-Bug: #1936776
Change-Id: I2901ea548332a043a8ffeb268f3a0ccbca265377
"}]
commit_message:
Don't generate 10-neutron_wsgi.conf with internal tls

When internal TLS is enabled we use a proxy in front of
neutron server. Config generated in change
I302558e718ce35c4d632137c5efa08f502939b40 conflicts with
the one generated for tls_proxy. Till we convert neutron_api
to be deployed with httpd, let's generate the wsgi config
only when enable_internal_tls is false.

Closes-Bug: #1936776
Change-Id: I2901ea548332a043a8ffeb268f3a0ccbca265377
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/57/801557/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: include tripleo::profile::base::apache else { class { 'neutron::wsgi::apache': ssl_cert => $tls_certfile, ssl_key => $tls_keyfile, } }

commit_message:
Pin tenacity and psycopg2 for py35/xenial

The libraries:

 * tenacity >= 8.0.0
 * psycopg2 >= 2.9.0
 * requests >= 2.26.0

dropped py35 support, thus breaking on Xenial.  This pins those
libraries.

Change-Id: Ie565747b28d0e21c83725837516b04db641de4a5
Closes-Bug: #1934107
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-vault refs/changes/42/801042/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # for xenial support, tenacity 8.0.0+ drops support for py35 tenacity<8.0.0# for xenial support, psycopg 2.9.0 drops support for py35 psycopg2<2.9.0

subject: Trim line breaks from pacemaker bundle function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-21 21:13:48.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/functions/pacemaker_bundle_replicas.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/0048bfc1a7a6624f3ce1f9189a249ca190969a67', 'message': 'Trim line breaks from pacemaker bundle function

On CentOS9, the cibadmin query is returning '\n' if the bundle is not
defined which results in:

Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, invalid
value for Integer(): "\n" (line: 1, column: 1) on node
standalone-0.localdomain

This change strips whitespace from the check to ensure it has a value
before we attempt to convert to an integer.

Change-Id: I369644d491357a8cdeae3eff51f4f595b1033b66
(cherry picked from commit 256d677dc74a96a2004213189730e6e0b9bbd195)
'}]
commit_message:
Trim line breaks from pacemaker bundle function

On CentOS9, the cibadmin query is returning '\n' if the bundle is not
defined which results in:

Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, invalid
value for Integer(): "\n" (line: 1, column: 1) on node
standalone-0.localdomain

This change strips whitespace from the check to ensure it has a value
before we attempt to convert to an integer.

Change-Id: I369644d491357a8cdeae3eff51f4f595b1033b66
(cherry picked from commit 256d677dc74a96a2004213189730e6e0b9bbd195)

commit_message:
[WIP][ffwd] Symlink /boot/grub2/grubenv /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv

Last option to make efi work on most systems is to
by default symlink the two grubenv files. This means
that some older RHEL8 grub will fail to boot.

Change-Id: I5f3556842f33d5a7ce1f384b7cab698ea7d0aaee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/73/787773/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # WA: copy the grubenv file from /boot/grub2/grubenv to /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv # and create simlink from /boot/grub2/grubenv to /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv - name: Create symlink /boot/grub2/grubenv > /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv file: src: /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv dest: /boot/grub2/grubenv state: link force: yes
deleted_lines: # WA: some versions of grub2 fail to look for grubenv in /boot/grub2/grubenv # In this case we copy the file instead of creating simlink making sure if # this is the case than grubenv is still available for previous bootrecord.

commit_message:
Improvements to federation packaging

While shibboleth and mod_auth_openidc can theoretically co installed
now, unfortunately the shibboleth enabled configuation will cause
issues when using mod_auth_openidc.
As we only drop the configuration for one of these apache mods at a time
I have decided that it is best we only support one of these packages
being present at any time to avoid conflicts.

Change-Id: Ib0ebf1711db42dd00b3e14c1e5604fed2632437d
(cherry picked from commit a57255b9fc9e30327d73b5fd502c2037f9c212dc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/86/801586/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: keystone_sp_apache_mod_packages: - name: libapache2-mod-shib state: "{{ keystone_sp_apache_mod_shib | ternary('present', 'absent') }}" - name: libapache2-mod-auth-openidc state: "{{ keystone_sp_apache_mod_auth_openidc | ternary('present', 'absent') }}" - name: "shib"
deleted_lines: keystone_sp_distro_packages: - "{{ keystone_sp_apache_mod_shib | ternary('libcurl3', 'libcurl4') }}" - "{{ keystone_sp_apache_mod_auth_openidc | ternary('libapache2-mod-auth-openidc', 'libapache2-mod-shib2') }}" - name: "shib2"

>       assert "synchronized: yes" in status_output
E       AssertionError: assert 'synchronized: yes' in '               Local time: Fri 2021-05-21 06:41:41 HST  \n           Universal time: Fri 2021-05-21 16:41:41 UTC  \n ...  \n              NTP service: active                       \n          RTC in local TZ: no                           '

Change-Id: Iaba35f237c75392586a4d86baef9bc7836c3fe1b

commit_message:
Force sync before checking clock status

We are seeing occasional failures of the test_ntp_clock_synchronized
test in the kayobe-overcloud-host-configure-ubuntu-focal job:

______________________ test_ntp_clock_synchronized[local] ______________________
host = <testinfra.host.Host local>
    def test_ntp_clock_synchronized(host):
        # Tests that the clock is synchronized
        status_output = host.check_output("timedatectl status")
>       assert "synchronized: yes" in status_output
E       AssertionError: assert 'synchronized: yes' in '               Local time: Fri 2021-05-21 06:41:41 HST  \n           Universal time: Fri 2021-05-21 16:41:41 UTC  \n ...  \n              NTP service: active                       \n          RTC in local TZ: no                           '
src/opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/playbooks/kayobe-overcloud-host-configure-base/tests/test_overcloud_host_configure.py:171: AssertionError

Forcing a clock sync before checking clock status should prevent this
issue.

Change-Id: Iaba35f237c75392586a4d86baef9bc7836c3fe1b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/01/792701/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Force clock sync host.check_output("sudo chronyc -a makestep")

This is the most minimal change which should enable the AIO build
to use Mitogen. Multinode builds will not work. This relies on a
patched version of Mitogen.

This change also adds the "mitogen_via" parameter to the stock
inventory from within the container host name group variables.
This will allow mitogen to connect to containers using the
physical host as a bastion without taking away our ability
to add more remotes via overrides or group_vars.

commit_message:
[WIP] Use the Mitogen connection method in OSA

This is the most minimal change which should enable us to use
Mitogen by adding the "mitogen_via" parameter to the stock
inventory from within the container host name group variables
and setting the `ansible_host` key to the expected inventory
hostname when executing against a container. This will allow
mitogen to connect to containers using the physical host as a
bastion which will allow deployers the ability to setup
additional gateways using secondary, overlay, inventories as
needed.

Mitogen Issue: https://github.com/dw/mitogen/issues/510
> Role requirements for mitogen is using an issue branch which enables
  the inventory to address container specific entities with the new
  `mitogen_container_name` key.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/717728
Change-Id: I023e9ebf99d27332ed0083319d27ae4019bddccb
Co-authored-by: Jonathan Rosser <jonathan.rosser@rd.bbc.co.uk>
Co-authored-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
Signed-off-by: cloudnull <kevin@cloudnull.com>

subject: ironic: always enable conductor HTTP server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-19 09:11:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/a5ac90908fb03f5dd01a43d671327e5525fab203', 'message': 'ironic: Enable iPXE booting by default

In the Xena release, Ironic removed the iSCSI driver [1]. The
recommended driver is direct, which uses HTTP to transfer the disk
image. This requires an HTTP server, and the simplest option is to use
the one deployed when enable_ironic_ipxe is set to true. For this
reason, this patch sets enable_ironic_ipxe to true by default. Ironic
users should note that it is necessary to enable the ipxe boot interface
via [DEFAULT] enabled_boot_interfaces in order to use iPXE booting.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/789382

Change-Id: I30c2ad2bf2957ac544942aefae8898cdc8a61ec6
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2021-07-19 10:58:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/62ed5801f84f02993d308658f67f03a9ed485a2c', 'message': 'ironic: Enable iPXE booting by default

In the Xena release, Ironic removed the iSCSI driver [1]. The
recommended driver is direct, which uses HTTP to transfer the disk
image. This requires an HTTP server, and the simplest option is to use
the one deployed when enable_ironic_ipxe is set to true. For this
reason, this patch sets enable_ironic_ipxe to true by default. Ironic
users should note that it is necessary to enable the ipxe boot interface
via [DEFAULT] enabled_boot_interfaces in order to use iPXE booting.

Also copy across IPA kernel & ramdisk images to the PXE (TFTP)
container, even when iPXE is enabled. This allows for a mixed PXE/iPXE
setup.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/789382

Change-Id: I30c2ad2bf2957ac544942aefae8898cdc8a61ec6
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2021-07-20 11:40:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/03d9cd4b95e43b67854ef31da6fcdd1b1b4a0228', 'message': 'ironic: always enable conductor HTTP server

In the Xena release, Ironic removed the iSCSI driver [1]. The
recommended driver is direct, which uses HTTP to transfer the disk
image. This requires an HTTP server, and the simplest option is to use
the one currently deployed when enable_ironic_ipxe is set to true. For
this reason, this patch always enables the HTTP server running on the
conductor.

iPXE is still enabled separately, since it cannot currently be used at
the same time as PXE.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/789382

Change-Id: I30c2ad2bf2957ac544942aefae8898cdc8a61ec6
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2021-07-20 14:24:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/95b77f1b7a19f830d5c86fa4c28cfe37089fa077', 'message': 'ironic: always enable conductor HTTP server

In the Xena release, Ironic removed the iSCSI driver [1]. The
recommended driver is direct, which uses HTTP to transfer the disk
image. This requires an HTTP server, and the simplest option is to use
the one currently deployed when enable_ironic_ipxe is set to true. For
this reason, this patch always enables the HTTP server running on the
conductor.

iPXE is still enabled separately, since it cannot currently be used at
the same time as PXE.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/789382

Change-Id: I30c2ad2bf2957ac544942aefae8898cdc8a61ec6
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2021-07-21 09:03:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/2c9e3ae10593761806ac94fa3e9b5775409e452c', 'message': 'ironic: always enable conductor HTTP server

In the Xena release, Ironic removed the iSCSI driver [1]. The
recommended driver is direct, which uses HTTP to transfer the disk
image. This requires an HTTP server, and the simplest option is to use
the one currently deployed when enable_ironic_ipxe is set to true. For
this reason, this patch always enables the HTTP server running on the

commit_message:
ironic: always enable conductor HTTP server

In the Xena release, Ironic removed the iSCSI driver [1]. The
recommended driver is direct, which uses HTTP to transfer the disk
image. This requires an HTTP server, and the simplest option is to use
the one currently deployed when enable_ironic_ipxe is set to true. For
this reason, this patch always enables the HTTP server running on the
conductor.

iPXE is still enabled separately, since it cannot currently be used at
the same time as PXE.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/789382

Change-Id: I30c2ad2bf2957ac544942aefae8898cdc8a61ec6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/67/801267/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iPXE booting ~~~~~~~~~~~~ As of the Kolla Ansible Xena release, iPXE booting is enabled by default. It may be disabled by setting ``enable_ironic_ipxe`` to ``no`` in ``/etc/kolla/globals.yml``: enable_ironic_ipxe: "no" When iPXE booting is enabled, this will enable deployment of a docker container, called ``ironic_ipxe``, running the web server which iPXE uses to obtain its boot images. The server may also used by the ``direct`` deploy interface to serve disk images.In order to enable the iPXE driver in ironic, set the ``[DEFAULT] enabled_boot_interfaces`` option in ``/etc/kolla/config/ironic.conf``: .. code-block:: yaml [DEFAULT] enabled_boot_interfaces = ipxe
deleted_lines: Enable iPXE booting (optional) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ You can optionally enable booting via iPXE by setting ``enable_ironic_ipxe`` to true in ``/etc/kolla/globals.yml``: enable_ironic_ipxe: "yes" This will enable deployment of a docker container, called ironic_ipxe, running the web server which iPXE uses to obtain it's boot images.- Ironic will be configured with the ``ipxe_enabled`` configuration option set to true

commit_message:
Fix ironic_ipxe healthcheck on Debian/Ubuntu

The healthcheck checks for a process called httpd, but these distros
call it apache2.  This results in the ironic_ipxe container being marked
as unhealthy.

This change fixes the issue by making the process name distro dependent.

Change-Id: I0b0126e3071146e7f8593ba970ecbed65b36fcfa
Closes-Bug: #1937037

commit_message:
Makes victoria tripleo release

Needs the depends-on as we are tagging that commit here for
puppet-tripleo. Mostly bumps bugfix except two that deserve
bumping .minor.

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2020-01-22 10:43:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-collect-logs/commit/14fe3ea71770575a4cb3ae97d85a110c348ffd5e', 'message': 'WIP: Improve resiliency of collection

- assure molecule report is fully colored on CI (notty)
- avoid warnings related to python interpreter detection
- avoid runtime warnings from ansible due to use of shell
- avoid displaying collection tasks as failed in console
- parallelize info collecting scripts
- now molecule job also produces a collected_logs inside tox folder,
  making easier to see what was collected during functional testing.

How to test the default scenario:
`molecule converge` or `tox -e molecule -- -k default`

Compare before/after this change:
- total duration
- number of runtime warnings from ansible going down
- number of tasks with errors
- number of collected files (should be lower as we now combine the
  small ones into report.json manifest file.

Change-Id: I08b2cf830104f6da1d2a83391ff7d9e864cb845f

- parallelize info collecting scripts
- now molecule job also produces a collected_logs inside tox folder,
  making easier to see what was collected during functional testing.

How to test the default scenario:
`molecule converge` or `tox -e molecule -- -k default`

Compare before/after this change:
- total duration
- number of runtime warnings from ansible going down
- number of tasks with errors
- number of collected files (should be lower as we now combine the
  small ones into report.json manifest file.

Change-Id: I08b2cf830104f6da1d2a83391ff7d9e864cb845f
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705059/

commit_message:
DNM: POC to parallelize collection commands

* parallelize info collecting scripts

Checklist for evaluating this change (before/after):
- total duration
- number of runtime warnings from ansible
- number of tasks with errors
- number of collected files

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/56/801756/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: enable_manila: "yes" CephFS ~~~~~~~~~ CephFS can be used as a storage backend for Manila shares. Configuring Manila for Ceph includes following steps: #. Enable Manila Ceph backend in ``globals.yml``: .. code-block:: yaml enable_manila: "yes" enable_manila_backend_cephfs_native: "yes" #. Configure Ceph authentication details in ``/etc/kolla/globals.yml``: * ``ceph_manila_keyring`` (default: ``ceph.client.manila.keyring``) * ``ceph_manila_user`` (default: ``manila``) .. note:: Required Ceph identity caps for manila user are documented in :manila-doc:`CephFS Native driver <admin/cephfs_driver.html#authorizing-the-driver-to-communicate-with-ceph>`. #. Copy Ceph configuration file to ``/etc/kolla/config/manila/ceph.conf`` #. Copy Ceph keyring to ``/etc/kolla/config/manila/<ceph_manila_keyring>`` #. Setup Manila in the usual way For more details on the rest of the Manila setup, such as creating the share type ``default_share_type``, please see :doc:`Manila in Kolla <manila-guide>`. For more details on the CephFS Native driver, please see :manila-doc:`CephFS Native driver <admin/cephfs_driver.html>`.

commit_message:
Xena-2 Release for python-cinderclient

This is the Xena milestone-2 release for python-cinderclient,
released as version 8.0.0.  It removes support for the Block
Storage API version 2, which was deprecated in Pike by change
I913c44799cdd.

Removing v2 support from the cinderclient was discussed on the
openstack-discuss mailing list:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018876.html

Signed-off-by: Herv Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9086dc5a86969dad6110ba837aba49df7444e058

subject: Remove wrong command in "ceph in kolla" guide.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-05 15:14:39.000000000', 'files': ['doc/ceph-guide.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/19582ffb4ba240fa27f9619f4e045cf7de36142c', 'message': 'Remove wrong command in "ceph in kolla" guide.

To use feature of external journal drive , install guide inform
to create a partition with parted as below.

parted /dev/sdb -s -- mklabel gpt
mkpart KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_J 0 5GB
parted /dev/sdb -s -- mklabel gpt
mkpart KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D 5GB 100%

Our prediction is that two partitions are created,
but in reality only one partition is created as below.

Number Start End Size File system Name Flags
 1 5000MB 107GB 102GB KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D

Because KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_J was override
by KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D.

To create two partitions, we need to remove mklabel gpt
in second command to create patition.

Closes-Bug: #1702500

Change-Id: Ic4e9da5d8c24c666319e728e38e55f23305c2134
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove wrong command in "ceph in kolla" guide.

To use feature of external journal drive , install guide inform
to create a partition with parted as below.

parted /dev/sdb -s -- mklabel gpt
mkpart KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_J 0 5GB
parted /dev/sdb -s -- mklabel gpt
mkpart KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D 5GB 100%

Our prediction is that two partitions are created,
but in reality only one partition is created as below.

Number Start End Size File system Name Flags
 1 5000MB 107GB 102GB KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D

Because KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_J was override
by KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D.

To create two partitions, we need to remove mklabel gpt
in second command to create patition.

Closes-Bug: #1702500

Change-Id: Ic4e9da5d8c24c666319e728e38e55f23305c2134
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>

commit_message:
Support ceph device classes feature

Device classes[1] is a new property of OSD. This feature allows the
data in the ceph pool to be placed in the specified OSDs. Only need
to specify the corresponding device class in the crush rule.

This commit supports the device classes feature and updates the steps
to create a pool.

[1]https://ceph.com/community/new-luminous-crush-device-classes/

Change-Id: Icd09101d10088955337b32026361983c6b7d5c7c

commit_message:
Support for specifying ceph daemons to be deployed

Currently, deploying ceph using kolla-ansible will include all
enabled daemons, such as mon, mgr, osd, rgw and mds, etc. But the
disadvantage is that modifying one daemon may affect all other
daemons.
For example, when osd is broken, the user only wants to redeploy osd
and does not want to redeploy other daemons.

This function can be used with --limit (limit the node that the task
executes), so that you can modify a daemon on a node.

Change-Id: Ia904d98b2677a478bf67df45b5d36193fc52766a
Closes-bug: #1822250

commit_message:
Replace merge_configs with merge_yaml

MongoDB uses YAML format config file. Kolla-ansible
needs to use merge_yaml rather than merger_configs
which for ini-style configs.

Change-Id: I27a9e762799905275e400cc0b53d4b1d4d4c7e84

commit_message:
POC: Enable check-requirements

This should enable check-requirements job which is a pre-requisite for
having a project listed under openstack requirements. This should allow
us to control the version of molecule being used during testing without
having to update our local requirements so often.

Change-Id: Iba95dceb1bc585702f558e706b65c20c62074b95
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/797620

commit_message:
Add mon detection to ceph deployment

When using '--limit' to deploy a node of ceph, such as repairing mon,
repairing osd and other tasks, kolla-ansbile will report an error.
This is because the current deployment must include the mon node to
set the 'delegate_host' parameter.

This commit fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Ic484467cfde2b00694d6685beb8c29b9b630cdbb
Closes-bug: #1822219

Made some optimizations for the deployment of ceph.

1. As with other modules, no configuration file is generated for
components that are not enabled;

2. Added container detection, including mon, osd and other components;

3.The previous deployment only restarts the container when the image
changes. The current deployment process restarts the container when
the image changes or ceph.conf changes or config.json changes.

4. Because the dependencies between the components of the ceph are
strong, so the ceph deployment is divided into several parts, mon,
mgr, osd, rgw, mds, and finally nfs. The corresponding configuration
section is also changed to call separately.

Closes-bug: #1712531

1. As with other modules, no configuration file is generated for

'}, {'number': 19, 'created': '2018-08-16 09:35:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/e0ea8c69eed720d9a8c598d838ad67878a922855', 'message': 'Optimize the deployment of ceph

Made some optimizations for the deployment of ceph.

1. Considering the startup sequence of ceph, it is necessary to
separately configure the service and trigger hanlder to restart the
service.
2. Adjusted the location of some tasks to make the service more
convenient to split.
3. Use the "include_task" dynamic loading feature to start the
service with start.yml.
4.The previous deployment only restarts the container when the image
changes. The current deployment process restarts the container when
the image changes or ceph.conf changes or config.json changes. In
particular, the "ceph_conf_change_restart" parameter has been added
to control whether the service is restarted when the configuration
file is changed.

Closes-bug: #1712531

Change-Id: If00671d83174f18cacf1849ce331ace3477fa09f

'}, {'number': 24, 'created': '2019-05-08 02:48:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/8f0ae682d47df6bf6f2457f3bc8947fadd290fd8', 'message': 'Optimize the deployment of ceph

1. Considering the startup sequence of ceph, it is necessary to
separately configure the service and trigger hanlder to restart the
service.
2. Use the "include_task" dynamic loading feature to start the
service with start.yml.
3. Add mon's detection task, because 'delegate_host' must have a
value at the node where mon is located, which prevents us from using
'--limit' to fix the osd node separately.
4. The current deployment will affect all enabled services, which is
not conducive to maintaining the entire cluster. This commit adds
'ceph_install_daemons' so that we can control the services to be
installed.
5. The previous deployment only restarts the container when the image
changes. The current deployment process restarts the container when
the image changes or ceph.conf changes or config.json changes. Users
can use the "ceph_conf_change_restart" parameter to control whether
to restart the container when ceph.conf changes.
6. The osd container may have problems frequently. At this time, we
need to fix osd and not affect other osd, so we have to avoid image
changes, which makes us very passive, because sometimes the image will
fix some bugs. This commit adds a judgment on the running container.
Use 'ceph_container_running_restart' to avoid restarting the running
container in deploy.

Change-Id: If00671d83174f18cacf1849ce331ace3477fa09f

changes. The current deployment process restarts the container when
the image changes or ceph.conf changes or config.json changes. Users

commit_message:
Optimize the deployment of ceph

1. Considering the startup sequence of ceph, it is necessary to
separately configure the service and trigger hanlder to restart the
service.
2. Use the "include_task" dynamic loading feature to start the
service with start.yml.
3. Add mon's detection task, because 'delegate_host' must have a
value at the node where mon is located, which prevents us from using
'--limit' to fix the osd node separately.
4. The current deployment will affect all enabled services, which is
not conducive to maintaining the entire cluster. This commit adds
'ceph_install_daemons' so that we can control the services to be
installed.
5. The previous deployment only restarts the container when the image
changes. The current deployment process restarts the container when
the image changes or ceph.conf changes or config.json changes. Users
can use the "ceph_conf_change_restart" parameter to control whether
to restart the container when ceph.conf changes.
6. The osd container may have problems frequently. At this time, we
need to fix osd and not affect other osd, so we have to avoid image
changes, which makes us very passive, because sometimes the image will
fix some bugs. This commit adds a judgment on the running container.
Use 'ceph_container_running_restart' to avoid restarting the running
container in deploy.

Change-Id: If00671d83174f18cacf1849ce331ace3477fa09f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/08/496608/25 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Ensuring config directories exist for mon and osd when: inventory_hostname in groups['ceph-mon'] or inventory_hostname in groups['ceph-osd'] - name: Ensuring config directories exist for rgw file: path: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item }}" state: "directory" recurse: yes with_items: - "ceph-rgw" when: - inventory_hostname in groups['ceph-rgw'] - enable_ceph_rgw | bool - name: Copying over config.json files for mon and osd services when: inventory_hostname in groups['ceph-mon'] or inventory_hostname in groups['ceph-osd'] - name: Copying over config.json files for rgw service template: src: "{{ item }}.json.j2" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item }}/config.json" with_items: - "ceph-rgw" when: - inventory_hostname in groups['ceph-rgw'] - enable_ceph_rgw | bool - name: Copying over ceph.conf for mon and osd merge_configs: vars: service_name: "{{ item }}" when: inventory_hostname in groups['ceph-mon'] or inventory_hostname in groups['ceph-osd'] - name: Copying over ceph.conf for rgw merge_configs: vars: service_name: "{{ item }}" sources: - "{{ role_path }}/templates/ceph.conf.j2" - "{{ node_custom_config }}/ceph.conf" - "{{ node_custom_config }}/ceph/{{ inventory_hostname }}/ceph.conf" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item }}/ceph.conf" with_items: when: - inventory_hostname in groups['ceph-rgw'] - enable_ceph_rgw | bool
deleted_lines: - name: Ensuring config directories exist - "ceph-rgw" - name: Copying over config.json files for services - "ceph-rgw" - name: Copying over ceph.conf vars: service_name: "{{ item }}" merge_configs:

commit_message:
Use specific Haproxy command

When kolla's patch 671178 is merged, haproxy
command will be the same in different distros.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/671178
Change-Id: Id8826adcb7e6b020bff065cb32f2c756eb305570
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/80/671180/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: {% set haproxy_cmd='/usr/sbin/haproxy -W -db' if kolla_base_distro in ['ubuntu'] else '/usr/sbin/haproxy-systemd-wrapper' %} xargs {{ haproxy_cmd }} -p /run/haproxy.pid -f /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg

commit_message:
Add vendor_passthru method for subscriptions

This patch adds two new vendor_passthru methods for Redfish:
- create_subscription (create a sbuscription)
- delete_subscription (delete a subscription)
- get_all_subscriptions (get all subscriptions on the node)
- get_subscription (get a single subscription)

Unit Tests in test_utils split into multiple classes to avoid random
failures due to cache.

Tested in bifrost env using two different HW:
- HPE EL8000 e910
- Dell R640

Story: #2009061
Task: #42854
Change-Id: I5b7fa99b0ee64ccdc0f62d9686df655082db3665

commit_message:
Fix a typo in the document

This patch changes 'oslopolicy-policy-generator' to
'oslopolicy-checker' in oslopolicy-checker.rst.

Change-Id: I73621ced00404d164fdb23f077ee36fbb6faf717

subject: Fix empty match while setting supported_policy_files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-02 15:59:41.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/horizon/tasks/policy_item.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/93e1ed14820f2c41f93ae1c746675f96073bfd57', 'message': 'Fix empty match while setting supported_policy_files

When supported_policy_files gets set under python 3.7 [1], the regex '(.*)'
matches twice, once for the policy file name and once more for the empty string
that follows the policy file name. This is new behavior under python
3.7. [2]

This leads to the replacement string being written out twice resulting
in something like this: "nova_policy.yamlnova_".

This patch changes the regex to '(.+)' ensuring there is no match success
against the empty string.

[1]:
- set_fact:
    supported_policy_files: "{{ supported_policy_format_list | map('regex_replace', '(.*)', '{{ project_name }}_\\1') | list }}"

[2]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html#re.sub

Change-Id: Ie5278832e293364c66d53ddb07dff9c5409f0cc6
Closes-Bug: 1851249
(cherry picked from commit 9d0ccad15aa358cdc6dc2f690bf181cb8354d150)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix empty match while setting supported_policy_files

When supported_policy_files gets set under python 3.7 [1], the regex '(.*)'
matches twice, once for the policy file name and once more for the empty string
that follows the policy file name. This is new behavior under python
3.7. [2]

This leads to the replacement string being written out twice resulting
in something like this: "nova_policy.yamlnova_".

This patch changes the regex to '(.+)' ensuring there is no match success
against the empty string.

[1]:
- set_fact:
    supported_policy_files: "{{ supported_policy_format_list | map('regex_replace', '(.*)', '{{ project_name }}_\\1') | list }}"

[2]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html#re.sub

Change-Id: Ie5278832e293364c66d53ddb07dff9c5409f0cc6
Closes-Bug: 1851249
(cherry picked from commit 9d0ccad15aa358cdc6dc2f690bf181cb8354d150)

commit_message:
Adding molecule test for fetch-images role

This patch adds a molecule scenario using the docker driver for the
fetch-images roles. It avoids fetching from network since tests
cannot rely on that to pass or not, and uses file:/// to get the
image and calculate the md5sum.

Change-Id: I53bbbfa17203191b98595b2125dee3bf312fd912
Taiga: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1460

commit_message:
Add py39 testing and support

We are switching to use the python3-wallaby template [1] but with
py39 voting so we explicitly override and add it to the gate. We also
want to keep py37 tests so this is also added to the gate as the wallaby
template doesn't cover it.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/commit/c5112bc8a155f0c37174ce419bed57a1fc80dd04/zuul.d/project-templates.yaml#L612

Change-Id: Id9dc68ce9763c3524b060d7824740b1d7c4ba41b

commit_message:
Updating Readme

Change-Id: Ia9b2ef9ca4a2f1e59806b6248215df493c73c852
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci-health-queries refs/changes/53/799453/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## How sova patterns works sova-patterns.json has 2 main keys/sections - `regex` and `patterns` `regex` has fields - `regex` which is the actual regular expression to searched in the files, and `name` which is a unique readable identifier for the regex. - `patterns` has keys/sections which correspond to type of files (like console, error, syslog, ironic-conductor etc) - `multiline` which is true for mutiline regexes Each of these sections has items which has - `id` - `pattern` which refers to the regex `name` in `regex` section. If there are no regexes for it then this pattern is the regex - `logstash` (again refers to the regex section but not used anywhere) - `msg` - this is what user sees in the output file name after sova finds the corresponding regex in the files - `tag` - denotes type of failure - infra/code etc - Choose an item from ` patterns ` in output/sova-patterns.json. This is the file that sova currently uses. Example 1: ``` "patterns": { "console": [ { "id": 1, "logstash": "", "msg": "Overcloud stack installation: SUCCESS.", "pattern": "Stack overcloud CREATE_COMPLETE", "tag": "info" }, ... ] ... } ``` ^ Here "Stack overcloud CREATE_COMPLETE" is not present in `regexes`. So this is how it will look after conversion to new format. ``` - id: Overcloud stack installation: SUCCESS pattern: "Stack overcloud CREATE_COMPLETE" tags: console ``` Example 2: ``` "patterns": { ... "ironic-conductor": [ ... { "id": 301, "logstash": "is located doesn't have enough disk space. Required", "msg": "No space on disk for Ironic.", "pattern": "iron_space_re", "tag": "infra" } ] } ``` ^ Here "iron_space_re" is present in `regexes` ``` { "regex": "Disk volume where .* is located doesn't have enough disk space", "name": "iron_space_re" }, ``` So this is how it will look after conversion to new format. ``` - id: iron_space_re pattern: "is located doesn't have enough disk space. Required" regex: "Disk volume where .* is located doesn't have enough disk space" tags: ironic-conductor ```
deleted_lines: - Choose an item from ``` regexes ``` in output/sova-patterns.json. This is the file that sova currently uses. (Do not look at patterns for now) - If the regex feels still relevant, vote for it here https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/16rqgaSSoQrYNjsI4q0YInJxrOOJL3xyP3t3D6ZpluFY/edit#gid=846893892 - Add a query entry in src/data/queries.yml - id: `name` of the regexes item you chose. - pattern: If you want this error to be shown in ER dashboard add a string here corresponding to the regex - regex: `regex` of the regexes item you chose.

commit_message:
gnocchi: add python3-rados to gnocchi-base source image

The binary images include python3-rados as a dependency, but source
images do not. This change fixes that.

Change-Id: I2c8cdfcd25856ecdcfd9f302965187b3b62376ad
Closes-Bug: #1927756
(cherry picked from commit c29f818696c74fd32b929a763695d244e112a33c)

commit_message:
Add molecule dependencies

As several projects are using molecule testing framework to
test ansible bit, it makes sense to add them to upper constraints so
we can avoid conflicts or regressions from newer releases.

Change-Id: Ia818ded9a5a38bd6c54e6674c37f2e7f4e7584ab

commit_message:
Fixes ignored failure to run repo config-manager

Because we used `|| true`, we failed to spot the missing sudo for a
very long time.

New code avoids global ignore of errors and enables epel only if
is found among the available repos.

Change-Id: I4bb8878d3dd5b0bd449f6c8659c92bc31388e010
Example: https://review.rdoproject.org/zuul/build/cf703d876f5740088f0571fd8e5cf82f

commit_message:
Run collect logs with v1 verbosity

Avoids creating huge logs on collect which make hard to even load
inside the browser.

Related: TRIPLEOCI-305

commit_message:
Make use of black formatting

- removes lots of flake8 ignored errors which are automatically
  fixed by black reformatting
- activate black
- move flake8 config to recommended official location in order to
  assure it used by all tools (any config put inside pre-commit would
  not be available outside it)

Note that all the files touched that are not in the root of this
repository were reformatted by black, which assures that the byte-code
is the same before and after the reformatting.

Change-Id: Ie463d17a71b2c85a0951aabfd5637f28c809d257

commit_message:
WIP: Test use of tox-ansible as test runner

This change aims to reuse tox-ansible plugin in order to eliminate
most of our custom code used for running molecule scenarios.

When ready it should work like:
- each molecule scenario would be visible as a tox environment,
  running `tox -va` will display all available scenarios and which
  effective molecule commands they really run
- zuul will call tox for scenarios
- developers should be able to run a specific scenario locally by
  just calling `tox -e scenario-name`

Change-Id: I193b2c583921a8cd4c83267dc23e051be553f6bc

commit_message:
Run flake8 using pre-commit

- Runs flake8 using pre-commit so we can easily add other
  linters/hooks and keep them isolated.
- Moves flake8 config to recommended location
- Upgrades hacking to latest version (4.4.0)
- Fixes problems reported by the upgraded linter

Change-Id: I80c190c24c907e5074e5e79edcdfc08bec689fb3
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/hacking/+/783820

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit and fix constraints

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the release
is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

With the introduction of the new dependency resolver in 20.3 pip the
lower-constraints job starts to fail as now the constraints are working
as they should. Multiple fixes needed:
* lower-constraints job uses the [testenv]install_command, so it gives
  both the upper-constraints and lower-constraints, which causes the
  job to fail. As an easy fix install_command is added to this target
  without the upper constraints.
* duplicate stestr constraint removed
* cryptography lower constraint is bumped as with version 2.1 the
  new resolver of pip takes hours to install the packages
* lower-constraints test job failed with error message:
  "[..] unexpected keyword argument 'barbican_endpoint_type'"
  which is due to old version of castellan.

Conflicts:
    requirements.txt
    test-requirements.txt

NOTE(elod.illes): some requirements change is not necessary in stein,
thus, were removed. On the other hand, sphinx requirement had to be
added to make requirements-check job pass.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663
[4] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/665

Change-Id: I4b33c2544c911bd68ed8af4c754c9f5dc0c93be8
(cherry picked from commit 43997de7bda3c0f3dcd4c8ec234167122cadd529)

commit_message:
Switch tripleo-ci-base-multinode job to use single playbook

As described in the related bug we are seeing timeouts here and
using a single playbook has been shown to fix it.

commit_message:
db: Remove old sqlalchemy-migrate migrations

These are no longer used and no longer necessary. Remove them.

Change-Id: Ibd7d46aefb3794dd342c8afb40dbb8d4ce00a976
Implements: blueprint remove-sqlalchemy-migrate
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from sqlalchemy import Column, MetaData, Table from glance.db.sqlalchemy.schema import ( Boolean, DateTime, BigInteger, Integer, String, Text, from_migration_import) # noqa def get_images_table(meta): """ Returns the Table object for the images table that corresponds to the images table definition of this version. """ images = Table('images', meta, Column('id', Integer(), primary_key=True, nullable=False), Column('name', String(255)), Column('disk_format', String(20)), Column('container_format', String(20)), Column('size', BigInteger()), Column('status', String(30), nullable=False), Column('is_public', Boolean(), nullable=False, default=False, index=True), Column('location', Text()), Column('created_at', DateTime(), nullable=False), Column('updated_at', DateTime()), Column('deleted_at', DateTime()), Column('deleted', Boolean(), nullable=False, default=False, index=True), mysql_engine='InnoDB', extend_existing=True) return images def upgrade(migrate_engine): meta = MetaData() meta.bind = migrate_engine # No changes to SQLite stores are necessary, since # there is no BIG INTEGER type in SQLite. Unfortunately, # running the Python 005_size_big_integer.py migration script # on a SQLite datastore results in an error in the sa-migrate # code that does the workarounds for SQLite not having # ALTER TABLE MODIFY COLUMN ability dialect = migrate_engine.url.get_dialect().name if not dialect.startswith('sqlite'): (get_images_table,) = from_migration_import( '003_add_disk_format', ['get_images_table']) images = get_images_table(meta) images.columns['size'].alter(type=BigInteger())

commit_message:
BaR - Ceph Backup

Backup and Restore:
  This task aims to take a backup of the /var/lib/ceph directory and
copied to the shared directory.
  To be able to do it, we copy the way that the ceph-ansible project [1]
deactivates the mds [2], so we can stop all the ceph services on the
controllers.

[1]-https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/
[2]-https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/v4.0.14/infrastructure-playbooks/rolling_update.yml#L550-L623

I left the comment below to describe and give some backgroud.
** Just splitting the patch into patches.
All the Randy's comments are implemented.
The other patch is https://review.opendev.org/#/c/732399/

Change-Id: I55681d69cacf2e7bee52d9a61f12d8577fe15a2d
(cherry picked from commit a930407217c7478a4b0141d28b9377973d840f97)

commit_message:
db: Stop checking for DB under sqlalchemy-migrate control

This has been in place since Ocata. If any version since then has been
deployed, this will have already been deployed. Time to drop this.

UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I5412d78c63cf3381782f5c6fc059641489f89053
Implements: blueprint remove-sqlalchemy-migrate
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

Please upgrade to Liberty release first.")) else: sys.exit(_("Unable to place database under Alembic's migration " "control. Unknown database state, can't proceed " "further.")) print(_("Placing database under Alembic's migration control at " "revision:"), alembic_version) alembic_command.stamp(a_config, alembic_version)

commit_message:
fix:fix an error while changing redis volume size

Trove version:rocky
In the logic of disk unloading of single redis instace,the exception loopingcall.LoopingCallTimeOut can not be catched;
The method trove.guestagent.volume._wait_for_mount return "True"
As a result, taskmanger raise a timeout error,volume-resize faild.

Steps to reproduce:
Create a single redis instance,then use cmd "trove resize-volume INSTANCE_ID 32" to expand volume from 16G to 32G,then an error occured.

Error log from taskmanager:
2021-06-01 19:25:16.652 25165 ERROR oslo_messaging.rpc.server GuestError: An error occurred communicating with the guest: Looping call timed out after
1.18 seconds.
Error log from guestagent:
ERROR oslo.service.loopingcall %self._error_time)
ERROR oslo.service.rpc.server %self._error_time)

Description about the error:
  Use cmd "trove show  INSTANCE_ID" ,the field volume is 32G. Then you log in to this nova_instance,use cmd "df -h",the size of Corresponding filesystem is still 16G.

Fix:To raise the extra Loopingcall.LoopcallTimeOut exception in trove.guestagent.volume._wait_for_monut

task: 42538
story: error while changing redis volume size
Change-Id: I2204a8821cee72b3c8969ade0f173c3e5f28f5c5

this.

commit_message:
db: Replace sqlalchemy-migrate call with alembic equivalent

The 'ocata_expand01_add_visibility' alembic migration was calling
'alter' on a table column, something that is only possible once you've
monkey patched sqlalchemy by importing the 'migrate' module. Resolve
this.

Change-Id: Ic71710aebafa38dceeead104b3e97fafa4bb4362
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

deleted_lines: images = Table('images', meta, autoload=True) images.c.is_public.alter(nullable=True, server_default=None)

commit_message:
Auto find greatest Fedora cloud image sub-release

Fedora cloud images have sub-releases in their filename. It is not
exacly clear how this is generated but we do know how we can determine
the greatest programatically.

Change-Id: I7fc56897c681fe037db211c290edcdd23cdd5d5b

gnocchi: add python3-rados to gnocchi-base source image

The binary images include python3-rados as a dependency, but source
images do not. This change fixes that.

commit_message:
Replace deprecated import of ABCs from collections

ABCs in collections should be imported from collections.abc and direct
import from collections is deprecated since Python 3.3.

Change-Id: Idacff95cbb276eda0bc55de771ce6c701363c2e1

commit_message:
Magic Search filter facet removal fix

When there is a text search and a filter facet applied together,
deleting the filter facet makes the remaining text search ignored.
This patch fixes it, calling text search if text facet remains.

Closes-Bug: #1930929

Change-Id: I343dc4220d572669a1b36ed9cf2d10d4dacf7166
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/99/794899/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if (angular.isDefined(ctrl.textSearch)) { // emit text search if text facet remains emitTextSearch(ctrl.textSearch || ''); }

commit_message:
Move placement specs to placement repo

Mistakenly the computing team merged two specs in nova that actually
targeting the placement service. Placement has its own specs directory
to store these. So this patch removes these specs and adds redirect for
them to point to the placement repository.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/placement/+/800769

Change-Id: I00662becb350557ba96bb119c91443ce27064782
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/75/800775/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================== Support Consumer Types ====================== .. note:: This is specification does not target the Nova services it only impacts the Placement service. https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2005473 This spec aims at providing support for services to model ``consumer types`` in placement. While placement defines a consumer to be an entity consuming resources from a provider it does not provide a way to identify similar "types" of consumers and henceforth allow services to group/query them based on their types. This spec proposes to associate each consumer to a particular type defined by the service owning the consumer. Problem description =================== In today's placement world each allocation posted by a service is against a provider for a consumer (ex: for an instance or a migration). However a service may want to distinguish amongst the allocations made against its various types of consumers (ex: nova may want to fetch allocations against instances alone). This is currently not possible in placement and hence the goal is to make placement aware of "types of consumers" for the services. Use Cases --------- * Nova using placement as its `quota calculation system`_: Currently this approach uses the nova_api database to calculate the quota on the "number of instances". In order for nova to be able to use placement to count the number of "instance-consumers", there needs to be a way by which we can differentiate "instance-consumers" from "migration-consumers". * Ironic wanting to differentiate between "standalone-consumer" versus "nova-consumer". Note that it is not within the scope of placement to model the coordination of the consumer type collisions that may arise between multiple services during their definition. Placement will also not be able to identify or verify correct consumer types (eg, INTANCE versus INSTANCE) from the external service's perspective. Proposed change =============== In order to model consumer types in placement, we will add a new ``consumer_types`` table to the placement database which will have two columns: #. an ``id`` which will be of type integer. #. a ``name`` which will be of type varchar (maximum of 255 characters) and this will have a unique constraint on it. The pattern restrictions for the name will be similar to placement traits and resource class names, i.e restricted to only ``^[A-Z0-9_]+$`` with length restrictions being {1, 255}. A sample look of such a table would be: +--------+----------+ | id | name | +========+==========+ | 1 | INSTANCE | +--------+----------+ | 2 | MIGRATION| +--------+----------+ A new column called ``consumer_type_id`` would be added to the ``consumers`` table to map the consumer to its type. The ``POST /allocations`` and ``PUT /allocations/{consumer_uuid}`` REST API's will gain a new (required) key called ``consumer_type`` which is of type string in their request body's through which the caller can specify what type of consumer it is creating or updating the allocations for. If the specified ``consumer_type`` key is not present in the ``consumer_types`` table, a new entry will be created. Also note that once a consumer type is created, it lives on forever. If this becomes a problem in the future for the operators a tool can be provided to clean them up. In order to maintain parity between the request format of ``PUT /allocations/{consumer_uuid}`` and response format of ``GET /allocations/{consumer_uuid}``, the ``consumer_type`` key will also be exposed through the response of ``GET /allocations/{consumer_uuid}`` request. The external services will be able to leverage this ``consumer_type`` key through the ``GET /usages`` REST API which will have a change in the format of its request and response. The request will gain a new optional key called ``consumer_type`` which will enable users to query usages based on the consumer type. The response will group the resource usages by the specified consumer_type (if consumer_type key is not specified it will return the usages for all the consumer_types) meaning it will gain a new ``consumer_type`` key. Per consumer type we will also return a ``consumer_count`` of consumers of that type. See the `REST API impact`_ section for more details on how this would be done. The above REST API changes and the corresponding changes to the ``/reshaper`` REST API will be available from a new microversion. The existing consumers in placement will have a ``NULL`` value in their consumer_type_id field, which means we do not know what type these consumers are and the service to which the consumers belong to needs to update this information if it wants to avail the ``consumer_types`` feature. Alternatives ------------ We could create a new REST API to allow users to create consumer types explicitly but it does not make sense to add a new API for a non-user facing feature. Data model impact ----------------- The placement database will get a new ``consumer_types`` table and the ``consumers`` table will get a new ``consumer_type_id`` column that by default will be ``NULL``. REST API impact --------------- The new ``POST /allocations`` request will look like this:: { "30328d13-e299-4a93-a102-61e4ccabe474": { "consumer_generation": 1, "project_id": "131d4efb-abc0-4872-9b92-8c8b9dc4320f", "user_id": "131d4efb-abc0-4872-9b92-8c8b9dc4320f", "consumer_type": "INSTANCE", # This is new "allocations": { "e10927c4-8bc9-465d-ac60-d2f79f7e4a00": { "resources": { "VCPU": 2, "MEMORY_MB": 3 }, "generation": 4 } } }, "71921e4e-1629-4c5b-bf8d-338d915d2ef3": { "consumer_generation": 1, "project_id": "131d4efb-abc0-4872-9b92-8c8b9dc4320f", "user_id": "131d4efb-abc0-4872-9b92-8c8b9dc4320f", "consumer_type": "MIGRATION", # This is new "allocations": {} } } The new ``PUT /allocations/{consumer_uuid}`` request will look like this:: { "allocations": { "4e061c03-611e-4caa-bf26-999dcff4284e": { "resources": { "DISK_GB": 20 } }, "89873422-1373-46e5-b467-f0c5e6acf08f": { "resources": { "MEMORY_MB": 1024, "VCPU": 1 } } }, "consumer_generation": 1, "user_id": "66cb2f29-c86d-47c3-8af5-69ae7b778c70", "project_id": "42a32c07-3eeb-4401-9373-68a8cdca6784", "consumer_type": "INSTANCE" # This is new } Note that ``consumer_type`` is a required key for both these requests at this microversion. The new ``GET /usages`` response will look like this for a request of type ``GET /usages?project_id=<project id>&user_id=<user id>`` or ``GET /usages?project_id=<project id>`` where the consumer_type key is not specified:: { "usages": { "INSTANCE": { "consumer_count": 5, "DISK_GB": 5, "MEMORY_MB": 512, "VCPU": 2 } "MIGRATION": { "consumer_count": 2, "DISK_GB": 5, "MEMORY_MB": 512, "VCPU": 2 } "unknown": { "consumer_count": 1, "DISK_GB": 5, "MEMORY_MB": 512, "VCPU": 2 } } } The new ``GET /usages`` response will look like this for a request of type ``GET /usages?project_id=<id>&user_id=<id>&consumer_type="INSTANCE"`` or ``GET /usages?project_id=<id>&consumer_type="INSTANCE"`` where the consumer_type key is specified:: { "usages": { "INSTANCE": { "consumer_count": 5, "DISK_GB": 5, "MEMORY_MB": 512, "VCPU": 2 } } } A special request of the form ``GET /usages?project_id=<project id>&consumer_type=all`` will be allowed to enable users to be able to query for the total count of all the consumers. The response for such a request will look like this:: { "usages": { "all": { "consumer_count": 3, "DISK_GB": 5, "MEMORY_MB": 512, "VCPU": 2 } } } A special request of the form ``GET /usages?project_id=<project id>&consumer_type=unknown`` will be allowed to enable users to be able to query for the total count of the consumers that have no consumer type assigned. The response for such a request will look like this:: { "usages": { "unknown": { "consumer_count": 3, "DISK_GB": 5, "MEMORY_MB": 512, "VCPU": 2 } } } Note that ``consumer_type`` is an optional key for the ``GET /usages`` request. The above REST API changes and the corresponding changes to the ``/reshaper`` REST API will be available from a new microversion. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- N/A Other end user impact --------------------- The external services using this feature like nova should take the responsibility of updating the consumer type of existing consumers from ``NULL`` to the actual type through the ``PUT /allocations/{consumer_uuid}`` REST API. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Upgrade impact -------------- The ``placement-manage db sync`` command has to be run by the operators in order to upgrade the database schema to accommodate the new changes. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <melwitt> Other contributors: <tssurya> <cdent> Work Items ---------- * Add the new ``consumer_types`` table and create a new ``consumer_type_id`` column in the ``consumers`` table with a foreign key constraint to the ``id`` column of the ``consumer_types`` table. * Make the REST API changes in a new microversion for: * ``POST /allocations``, * ``PUT /allocations/{consumer_uuid}``, * ``GET /allocations/{consumer_uuid}``, * ``GET /usages`` and * ``/reshaper`` Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Unit and functional tests to validate the feature will be added. Documentation Impact ==================== The placement API reference will be updated to reflect the new changes. References ========== .. _quota calculation system: https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:bp/count-quota-usage-from-placement History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Train - Introduced * - Xena - Reproposed

Update Block Storage API v2 api-ref

Add a note that the v2 API was removed in Xena.

Change-Id: I3dd81d81995913e30addf5bf4ee8a4406c36632f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/44/793244/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============================== Block Storage API V2 (REMOVED) ============================== .. note:: Version 2 of the Block Storage API was `deprecated in the Pike release <https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/cinder/pike.html#deprecation-notes>`_ and was removed during the Xena development cycle. `This document is maintained for historical purposes only.` `Version 3 <https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/>`_ of the Block Storage API was `introduced in the Mitaka release <https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/224910>`_. Version 3.0, which is the default microversion at the ``/v3`` endpoint, was designed to be identical to version 2. Thus, scripts using the Block Storage API v2 should be adaptable to version 3 with minimal changes.

commit_message:
Zanata stats tool: improve speed with user API

This patch enhances the speed of Zanata stats by using
user-based Zanata APIs rather than project-based APIs,
which took >1 days as more Zanata users and translation data
were accumulated.

Note that the API scheme follows with Stackalytics
: https://opendev.org/x/stackalytics/src/branch/master/stackalytics/processor/zanata.py#L38

Change-Id: Ia2462447f7a0cc2534e877976838de09e8683e89
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/i18n refs/changes/70/777870/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_user_stats(self, zanata_user_id, start_date, end_date): uri = ZANATA_URI % ('stats/user/%s/%s..%s' % (zanata_user_id, start_date, end_date)) trans_fields = ['total', 'Translated', 'NeedReview', 'Approved', 'Rejected'] review_fields = ['total', 'Approved', 'Rejected'] def read_from_zanata_stats(self, zanata_stats, project_list, version_list): # data format (Zanata 4.3.3) # [ # { # "savedDate": "2020-09-06", # "projectSlug": "i18n", # "projectName": "i18n", # "versionSlug": "master", # "localeId": "ko-KR", # "localeDisplayName": "Korean (South Korea)", # "savedState": "Translated", # "wordCount": 119 # } # ] for zanata_stat in zanata_stats: project_id = zanata_stat['projectSlug'] version = zanata_stat['versionSlug'] lang = zanata_stat['localeId'] stat_state = zanata_stat['savedState'] word_count = zanata_stat['wordCount'] if project_list and project_id not in project_list: continue if version_list and version not in version_list: continue if self.lang != lang: continue my_project = self.stats[project_id] if version not in my_project: my_project[version] = {} my_project[version]['translation-stats'] = {} my_project[version]['review-stats'] = {} my_version = my_project[version] if stat_state in self.trans_fields: if stat_state in my_version['translation-stats']: my_version['translation-stats'][stat_state] += word_count else: my_version['translation-stats'][stat_state] = word_count if 'total' in my_version['translation-stats']: my_version['translation-stats']['total'] += word_count else: my_version['translation-stats']['total'] = word_count if stat_state in self.review_fields: if stat_state in my_version['review-stats']: my_version['review-stats'][stat_state] += word_count else: my_version['review-stats'][stat_state] = word_count if 'total' in my_version['review-stats']: my_version['review-stats']['total'] += word_count else: my_version['review-stats']['total'] = word_count for user in users: if user_list and user.user_id not in user_list: continue LOG.info('Getting for user %(user_id)s %(user_lang)s', {'user_id': user.user_id, 'user_lang': user.lang}) data = zanataUtil.get_user_stats( user.user_id, start_date, end_date) LOG.debug('Got: %s', data) user.read_from_zanata_stats(data, project_list, version_list) LOG.debug('=> %s', user)
deleted_lines: def get_project_versions(self, project_id): uri = ZANATA_URI % ('projects/p/%s' % project_id) LOG.debug("Reading iterations for project %s" % project_id) project_data = self.read_json_from_uri(uri) if 'iterations' in project_data: return [interation_data['id'] for interation_data in project_data['iterations'] if self._is_valid_version(interation_data['id'])] else: return [] def get_user_stats(self, project_id, iteration_id, zanata_user_id, start_date, end_date): uri = ZANATA_URI % ('stats/project/%s/version/%s/contributor/%s/%s..%s' % (project_id, iteration_id, zanata_user_id, start_date, end_date)) trans_fields = ['total', 'translated', 'needReview', 'approved', 'rejected'] review_fields = ['total', 'approved', 'rejected'] def read_from_zanata_stats(self, zanata_stats, project_id, version): # data format (Zanata 3.9.6) # { # "username": "amotoki", # "contributions": [ # { # "locale": "ja", # "translation-stats": { # "translated": 7360, # "needReview": 0, # "approved": 152, # "rejected": 0 # }, # "review-stats": { # "approved": 220, # "rejected": 0 # } # } # ] # } stats = [d for d in zanata_stats['contributions'] if d['locale'] == self.lang] if not stats: return stats = stats[0] trans_stats = stats.get('translation-stats', {}) if trans_stats: trans_stats['total'] = sum(trans_stats.values()) review_stats = stats.get('review-stats', {}) if review_stats: review_stats['total'] = sum(review_stats.values()) self.stats[project_id][version] = {'translation-stats': trans_stats, 'review-stats': review_stats} for project_id in project_list: for version in zanataUtil.get_project_versions(project_id): if version_list and version not in version_list: continue for user in users: if user_list and user.user_id not in user_list: continue LOG.info('Getting %(project_id)s %(version)s ' 'for user %(user_id)s %(user_lang)s', {'project_id': project_id, 'version': version, 'user_id': user.user_id, 'user_lang': user.lang}) data = zanataUtil.get_user_stats( project_id, version, user.user_id, start_date, end_date) LOG.debug('Got: %s', data) user.read_from_zanata_stats(data, project_id, version) LOG.debug('=> %s', user)

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Since setuptools v54.1.0[1], dash-separated options causes a warning
message like [2] and we should replace dashes with underscores.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

[2]
UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I05d9c484bb669ae33211e88924b20b7cfe7d0d67

commit_message:
Add missing font for PDF generation

openstack-tox-docs job started to fail with the following error:

! LaTeX Error: File `tgtermes.sty' not found.

This patch adds the required font package to bindep doc profile.

Co-authored-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Closes-Bug: #1935742
Change-Id: Idc7ba5b1211327a258b2972f9271b09916598cb3

commit_message:
Scoped RBAC Devstack Plugin support

Adds support to the ironic devstack plugin to configure
ironic to be used in a scope-enforcing mode in line with
the Secure RBAC effort. This change also defines two new
integration jobs *and* changes one of the existing
integration.

In these cases, we're testing functional crub interactions,
integration with nova, and integration with ironic-inspector.

As other services come online with their plugins and
devstack code being able to set the appropriate scope
enforcement configuration, we will be able to change the
overall operating default for all of ironic's jobs and
exclude the differences.

This effort identified issues in ironic-tempest-plugin,
tempest, devstack, and required plugin support in
ironic-inspector as well, and is ultimately required
to ensure we do not break the Secure RBAC.

Luckilly, it all works.

Change-Id: Ic40e47cb11a6b6e9915efcb12e7912861f25cae7

commit_message:
Ignore stale image property removal

Occasionally we fail to delete a property from an image and get a
StaleDataError from SQLAlchemy. It looks like maybe we are just racing
with another operation to delete a single property (i.e. a race
between image delete and the end of an import cleanup).

This ignores that "can't delete because it is already deleted" error
and logs to debug about the situation for later auditing and
confirmation.

Change-Id: Ida5bc659b7481fa0a7f3926a54520628a7a4c406
Closes-Bug: #1895173

added_lines: try: prop.delete(session=session) except sa_orm.exc.StaleDataError: LOG.debug('StaleDataError while deleting property %r from image %r', prop_ref, image_ref) raise

commit_message:
db: Move 'schema' module up a level

We want to remove the old sqlalchemy-migrate based migrations. Move the
only remaining module we need from this up a level so we can 'rm -rf'
the entire directory in a future change.

Change-Id: I3b1a1668c48e3136fd91b1418e00c38deec76bb5
Implements: blueprint remove-sqlalchemy-migrate
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
container-reconciler: support multiple processes

This follows the same pattern of configuration used in the
object-expirer.  When the container-recociler has a configuration value
for processes it expects that many instances of the reconciler to be
configured with a process value from [0, processes).

Change-Id: Ie46bda37ca3f6e692ec31a4ddcd46f343fb1aeca

deleted_lines: LRUCache, decode_timestamps pool.spawn_n(self.process_queue_item, container, raw_obj['name'], queue_item)

commit_message:
vdpa: Introducing the vdpa PF flag

Now that nova supports vDPA interfaces, we need to configure them using
os_net_config for tripleo consumption.

Related: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-docs/+/798237/
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1917762
